website_summaries.verdict: Good design that allows quick access to a single firearm.
pros: Keypad can be programmed for single- or multi-key entry
LED light turns on when vault opens

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, right?  Junk would be a correct term.  Wish someone would have told me not to purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. Neither of them will open after the third time or 20 minutes of being closed. That is a pretty tight time frame to hope for a burglar. The battery either gets drained or the connector won't continue the circuit when I'm not actively holding it. Something I want to trust my life with? Terrible, expensive, isn't reliable. We've then switched to attaching the key to with a magnet but that has been phased out cause now the kids can climb, plus... seriously. So now I have 250$ worth of crap that is no longer capable of performing its only purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drains batteries way too fast
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this safe installed for about eight months now and have replaced the battery 5 times. There’s no way to tell if the battery is dead until it doesn't’ t open for you. I contacted customer service and was told that I need to use the right battery (I used the recommended type already) and if that wasn’t the problem then there was nothing they could do. What good is gun safe if you don’t know if will even open when you need it to? Awful product, customer support is a joke. It’s past it’s warranty so I’m throwing it in the trash and will do more research next time. Others reading this... learn from my mistake!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Critical failure at time of necessity is a strong possibility
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these and they were purchased to store my handguns safely and responsibly while allowing quick access in an emergency. These units do not see much activity at all and are operated less than 6 times in 12 months. LIKE: Worked great the first six months. DISLIKE: 2 out of 3 of my SV500 SpeedVault have failed to work. Due to electronic board failure, One unit fails to open and that is not acceptable. Due to internal plastic parts breakage One unit has failed to operate and that is not acceptable. I called customer service and was told that they have no warranty after 90 days and no serviceable parts.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Initially seemed good, but has a weak link
customer_reviews.text: This safe installed easily enough, programmed and cycled a few times. After a few cycles, the door that opens became loose and canted. Upon inspection, the rod that serves as a hinge had broken off the housing, making the safe insecure. The hinge rod was a stepped pin with a washer on each end. It was secured to the housing with a spot weld on each washer. The welds had no penetration allowing them to break during gentle operation. I had purchased two and returned both. Pictures show the hinge rod in both the broken and original state (second safe).
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Not top notch quality.
customer_reviews.text: No quite as quiet as I would like it. I had a similar product prior to this purchase, but I sold it with my travel trailer rather than leave holes behind. So I bought this one as a replacement. It's not smooth in its release, it sounds like the metal drop case rubs against the metal frame, and the touch pad won't accept a double digit entry no matter how many times we try. The screws on the bottom that hold the bumper foot are so tight they won't fully engage. I feel like this may be a knock-off product. Pretty disappointed in the quality, functionality, and overall product. For the money I wouldn't buy it again :(
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I liked this thing a lot, but a few days ago I changed the battery, closed it up with my duty pistol inside, and somehow the code I had been using for three years didn't work anymore! Then, when I tried to open in manually, the barrel lock mechanism pushed inwards and fell into the interior of the safe! What a piece of crap! So, I did what all responsible people do, took a hammer and flathead screwdriver and pried it open -- which took all of three minutes. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Goots

customer_reviews.title: Questionable in a crisis
customer_reviews.text: I have had the biometric one for a while. I liked the safe but not the reader (my finger prints are hard to read). So I picked this up and while the safe quality is ok the buttons leave much too be desired. You can't press the buttons to fast or it won't recognize your code. Or worst it will recognize only part of your code making you have to stop and wait for it to reset. This could prove DEADLY in a crisis. I would return this but it's too late.
customer_reviews.author: DesertGypsy

customer_reviews.title: GunVault Speed Vault SV500 Handgun Safe - great product for quick access to your handgun
customer_reviews.text: We really like this handgun safe for bedside installation. Unobtrusive looking slender case was easy to wall mount, and simple to use. We like this product a lot, and it's been very dependable to use. Best one currently on the market IMHO. Pro * Simple installation - can fit in plenty of spots * Handgun instantly ready * Lighted for just a few seconds to help you get a good grip * The best product of this type currently on market Con * Battery changes are clunky * Some minor mechanical noise when opened
customer_reviews.author: HockeyBuck

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this approx 6 months ago. Overall, am very pleased. While it does appear quality control may be an issue, mine has not failed in any of the ways other comments describe. Two things I will point out: The attachment hardware is most certainly lacking. I used some upgraded screws. Second, the lock mechanism is very loud. You can hear it unlock half way across the house on a quiet night. Unless the intruder is seriously impaired, the element of surprise will be lost. If you use this for home defense, either unlock it when you go to bed or practice rolling out of bed as you unlock it.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff B

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't if I were you...
customer_reviews.text: So when I finally got around to installing it I had already forgotten my code (completely my fault). But no worries, I had the keys to open it to reset the code. That is until the tumblers/pins fell out from the cylinder. The company now tells me there's nothing they can do. So.. A couple of lessons I've learned from this experience 1)make sure it's working before the warranty runs out. 2)never purchase anything from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Texacole

customer_reviews.title: Average product
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to prepare it . Removal of battery pack is quite tough- ordinary Chinese make .
customer_reviews.author: Nadeem khawaja ( wermany )

customer_reviews.title: While I like the design and general function I can't give this ...
customer_reviews.text: While I like the design and general function I can't give this much more than two stars due to the fact that twice now during routine checks to ensure it's working it has failed to open because the battery was dead, yet it has given no warning that the battery was getting low - as it is supposed to. Secondly, both times the battery had only been in the safe for a relatively short period of time (<1 year, and <3 months). I probably just got a lemon, but unfortunately I cannot continue to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: James in AZ

customer_reviews.title: I really like this vault, access in seconds.
customer_reviews.text: I have now been using this vault for over a month and it is very easy to program and use. I have a LTC and use this to secure my firearm when I get home, yet want it accessible if needed. It definitely exceeds my expectation for this purpose. I mounted behind the nightstand and I can access it very quickly from the bedside. I did not get the biometric version as I feel the code is just as fast and more reliable. I do not get code errors when accessing (I use 6 digit) nor could I figure out a situation where the keypad failed and opened. Great vault and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, a bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. I have several other Gunvault products, and this one is by far the most noisy when it opens (hence only 4 stars). The unlocking mechanism makes a a pretty loud clunk, and then the door makes an equally loud clunk when it falls open. (I don't have the biometric option on this or any of my safes, and don't know why anyone would want it- what if my finger is bleeding, or I have a band-aid on, or... too many things to go wrong. )
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 star quick access gun safety solution!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, and works quick to get to your hand gun. I wish it was just a bit wider or had a compartment to store an extra magazine in it. I didn't think it warranted me deducting a full star for that. Would have rated it more like 4.5 stars, because I can still squeeze an extra mag in it. But that was my only knock on it. It is a great solution to keep your loaded sidearm safe and secure but quickly accessible.
customer_reviews.author: vpetersleonard

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended if you have children like I do.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product, had it for over a year now, still have the same batteries in it and I test it every week to make sure it's functioning properly. My spous can operate it with ease too. I haven't had to use the backup key either. Installing this on my nightstand was a concern but it was very easy and really is low profiles with all the blankets, comforter, and pillow my spouse has on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Ted La Vigne

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS SECURE AS YOU THINK
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this to keep small children away, ok fine. But if you think for one second that it will stop a burglar from stealing it, you are quite mistaken. The keys are a joke, all you need is a blank, which can be 3D printed, to open it (see my photo) and that is "doing it the hard way". Thiefs know that these can be opened with basically any key that fits. Don't be fooled into thinking your gun is locked away from anyone that wants to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Safe fails in time of need...
customer_reviews.text: I was sold on the good reviews everyone else gave...and I've owned it for over 2 years...not a problem, then, a couple of days ago, I needed it right away and the safe wouldn't open. I put my code in, and nothing. You've got to be kidding me, right? Isn't the point of this safe the fact it was quick and reliable. I DO NOT TRUST this safe. It wasn't the battery that fail, it is fine...as it turns out it was the motor (as I discovered others online have the same problem I am having with it). The cable that links to the motor breaks after opening the safe over time. I will not buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Check right away..
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed... Finally had an opportunity to install after moving in to our new house, and it won't open. The key won't open the door. The key turns the lock with no resistance, and the door doesn't release. Been to long to return so it's going to get tossed into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Great safe, tricky install
customer_reviews.text: This safe does exactly what it advertises. Product is a bit bigger than you would think. Installation was a bit tricky, the instructions are not that great and took a minute to figure out but it can be done. If you are not good with minimalistic instructions, google a installation video. Love that there is a light, I do wish it would open a bit quicker after entering code, about a 2 second delay ( I know not much)
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: Great safe for my desk
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased the model with the biometric fingerprint reader but could not get a consistent read for my fingers. My wife had no problem. I returned that and purchased this model. It was easy to install and works great. My only gripe was getting the stop installed in the bottom of the safe. it was tough getting the screws in. The safe is security mounted to my desk in my office. Great product. Holds my full size 45 easily as well as my 1911.
customer_reviews.author: TCrox

customer_reviews.title: Broke After opening 5-6 times
customer_reviews.text: Tried new batteries, took the safe apart and circuit board is burnt up. They will not replace or warranty it! said the 5 yr warranty is for Fire or Burglary.... but won't cover their equipment! DO NOT BUY....unless you want to use the key every time.
customer_reviews.author: brooketilu

customer_reviews.title: Good option for quick access handgun storage
customer_reviews.text: Pros: many installation options, feels durable, presents the firearm in an accessible manner Cons: installing the battery is a pain, the vault opens with a noticeable delay, the metal is not thick enough to stop a determined thief with time or tools This is a well built quick access safe and will certainly slow down a thief or keep a handgun away from the kids. If used within the scope of its limitations, it is a good option, albeit a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Jon J.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: It simply does not work correctly. I punch in the (correct) code, the light turns green, but the door does not open. I called customer services and was told to replace the battery. I replace my batteries in safes regularly. I replaced the battery and it still does not open.
customer_reviews.author: BDJ

customer_reviews.title: I bought another one. Then another. Yeah. That good.
customer_reviews.text: One for the bedside, one for the desk & one for the living room. Little loud on the open. Watch the screw tension on the mounting bracket as if not tight enough will interfere with open. 20min install. Fits a 1911 full size, G17, G43, MP40, & M96A1with room for spare mag. See these go for $270 at locals. They must be buying them here too. The ability to conceal while maintaining structural integrity and easy access make this an easy choice. Honestly, these should be required if you have children. Less than a decent amount of ammo.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Love this style of Gun Access/Storage. I hope quality is there
customer_reviews.text: I most like the way the door popped open with quick access to the storage firearm. Least liked the 9 V battery compartment with the wire trying to get that battery and wire back in that storage compartment was ridiculously difficult. Overall installation and programming were easy. Received and installed same day this is day two so it’s still early. Concerned about a lot of the negative reviews for battery life and electronics functioning will update review at three months six months and one year. One side note to the manufacturer it would be lovely if this were 2 inches wider and had pockets for multiple mag storage as well.
customer_reviews.author: david artzt

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one Dec 2018 it worked well till Dec2019 and then completely turned to junk. Can’t get into it without key can’t program it. The LED lights burned out. Tried changing battery didn’t help. The thing is fried seems like. For what i payed i think it should have lasted longer than one year.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Perry

customer_reviews.title: Secure safe, convenient placement, batteries last a while.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 years ago to secure my home protection pistol. At the time I opted for the combo version rather than the biometric one because reviews stated that the biometric version used batteries very quickly. I can’t comment on that but I can say the combo version has had the same 9V battery in it for two years running. It is easy to open yet secure enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: CT Jim

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries. Probably won't work when you need it
customer_reviews.text: This thing eats batteries, and it seems to be getting worse over time. A battery will not last more than a week now. When I first got it it lasted maybe even 2 months. If you need the weapon in it, chances are better than not that it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kohlwey

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: works great just as expected. but be sure to make the combo is easy to remember and punch in so it's easy to access when needed. you can do 2 button combos where you press 2 buttons at the same time, but be careful on how many you do like that it can make it hard to remember. but at the same time make it harder for a child to figure out. great product i would think that Biometric version would be even better but due to the price being so high i haven't bought one yet to verify that. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, quick opening
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this style over most of the others on the market because it presents the pistol vertically like a holster would, e.g ready to be grasped in a combat grip and used. Buttons are large and obvious, you can also turn off the 'beeps' it makes when you press the buttons. Was easy to mount to a sturdy desk, easy to program, and has a handy interior light. Batteries haven't run out, but I'm of the 'change them every 6 months' school, just change them when you change your smoke alarm batteries (you do change them don't you??). Also has a key backup. The black matte finish is discrete and hides nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Locking Mechanism will not release.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it when I first got it but the opening mechanism quit working after 4 months. It lights up green like it wants to open but it does not. I changed the battery thinking it may have not had the juice to release the lock, also reprogrammed it. Still will not open without using a key. I get the gun out of the safe once a week so it’s not like it is heavily used. I’m very disappointed with this product. I will be calling tech support on Monday to see what they will do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like this product quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: I like this product quite a bit. I have it mounted inside a foyer closet for home defense. It's easy to set up and use. I practice opening it and grasping the gun (HK45) at least once a day so it will be second nature if I ever needed it although I'm certainly hoping that never happens. My only complaint is that I wish it was quieter when it opened. I fear that if I ever needed to get it discretely the opening sound would be a dead giveaway. (pun intended). I'm sure the drawer dropping open could be damped somehow to quiet it down but that would also likely slow the opening time and that is not desirable.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: The metal is solid. The fit was good, but.... I had to return because the plastic door that covers the battery came off the hinge. It didn't break, just popped off. However, I was completely unable to reseat the door as it is located inside the back wall of the safe. After what felt like 100 attempts, I gave up and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little safe
customer_reviews.text: I have order several of these in the past and the current one came with a damaged battery cover. That's something easily fix by myself so I didn't bother exchanging it. For durability, I am giving it 4 stars because of the battery cover and the location of the battery. I could have been in the foam area since there's plenty of space to hide a 9V battery in there too.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped opening after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea and it worked great for 2 weeks. Then it wouldn't not release door when I entered code. I replaced battery, which did not help. Promptly asked for Amazon return, my first ever return. Kudos to Amazon on a painless return process. If the next one does not work flawlessly I will ask for cash refund and find a better option. With this kind of item it could be a life or death situation, it needs to work every time.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Im pretty happy with this..It opens fast, and it means im always ready to go if there is and emergency..I have small kids, but i want access to a loaded firearm in a snap (just incase). This is the perfect solution..Its not going to keep a determined theif from stealing it,,but it will keep children from being able to get to it, and thats what its for..I think this was money well spent,,it's a win win..I did use 2" screws to secure it insted of the little thumb screws it came with..I also decided to go with the keypad V.S the biometric because its much more reliable i think..I will buy a couple more of these..
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep out of children's hands but into yours faster.
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is not to keep your gun from being stolen but to keep it out of your children's hands but into yours faster. Love the interior light Love the mute button Love the tamper indicator Love the pistol grip presentation upon opening
customer_reviews.author: NadiaMarie

customer_reviews.title: Its decent but I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Works good it just seems cheap and easy to break into. The battery doesn't last very long even if you use a top of the line battery. Sometimes it doesn't feel like it shuts right and that makes me nervous having little ones around. I'll use it until it breaks then ill buy something way better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sisney

customer_reviews.title: Great safe.
customer_reviews.text: We bought one from Costco and liked it so much we bought a 2nd one from Amazon. We attached them to the side of our nightstands and they work perfect. I feel safe with my gin easily accessible to me but safely locked away from my son.
customer_reviews.author: MarieC

customer_reviews.title: Beware and Test often!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 1 week. After that the vault refused to open. You could hear part of the 'normal click / thud' (only the click part) and the light would turn on, so I know the combination was working fine. However the door refused to open. Various pushing / pulling on the door while entering the code was no help. Used the key, changed the (1 week old battery) and same thing. Worked a few times, then stopped. Obviously this could have been a very dangerous situation had a crisis required access to the vault in an emergency. Returned the original vault for a replacement, we'll see how this one works out.
customer_reviews.author: Logic Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Fast and functional
customer_reviews.text: Great price compared to my local "Gun Store". Only problem I encountered was the instruction sheet. Need a better translation from Chinese. However, easy enough to figure out after a few minutes deliberating. Definitely need longer screws, if you want any security. After entering code, tested several times without any problems. Mute button is a nice touch. Beeping is quite loud. The ability to use two buttons at once, for the code, extends code options greatly. Disappointed my 9mm Sig P226 tac-ops did not fit. Twenty rnd mag just too much. But the full size S&W M&P 45 ACP squeezed in. Fast and easy access meets all my requirements for this product. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: guns donovan

customer_reviews.title: Great safe!!!
customer_reviews.text: This safe is great, exactly what I needed. Barely noticeable where I have it. Covered the key lock with a piece of black tape and you don't even notice it is on the wall. When the door opens, a light comes on so you can see the gun. The door does make a noise when it opens, but if you need to get the gun - I don't care about the noise. The price was also good, I did alot of searching and could not find a better price or even close to it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for what it is. My M&P 9L barely fits in it with a sight on top and a magazine loaded, I have to angle it when putting it in the safe. Gun sits straight once it is inside the safe. The install could have been easier, was a bit wonky trying to get the thumb screws installed to hold it on the bracket and a little hassle having to lightly disassemble and reassemble the safe to install it. Overall, happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stanton

customer_reviews.title: While the product does exactly what it states, the ...
customer_reviews.text: While the product does exactly what it states, the directions to set up for mounting could be a little more clear. The combination buttons need to be pressed firmly in order for it to activate the unlock sequence, a light touch does not always work. When the system unlocks, it is very loud. If you are trying to be quiet, opening the safe will tell anyone in the general area exactly where you are located. Overall the construction is solid. It will not take longer barreled pistols such as a 7 1/4" Ruger Blackhawk revolver.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Keeps my home defense firearm safe and secure. Easy to open by pressing large buttons. LED light comes on when door opens to "present" the firearm to you. I mounted from the rear so a good whack from a hammer would dislodge from the wall. It is not in my opinion for theft protection per se, but protection from unauthorized use. If you mount from sides you would have a greater degree of theft protection. I am planning on purchasing another one for my girlfriends side of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Chickenman40

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Its attached to my bed post ready to be accesed at any time(hopefully I never have the need). I own a glock17 and it fits like a glove. The materials and paint seem like top quality,the padding hugs the gun well, there is not much room for anything else, Would totally purchase a second one(once I get my wife to agree to place one ON HER SIDEOF THE BED)
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: The instruction manual on how to install was confusing. I found a video on YouTube showing step by step was very helpful. The key pad worked, but took me a few try to get it right. So far, it’s working fine, but read other reviews where people complained about battery drain quickly. I will provide another update if I encounter the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: zeroduskgiven

customer_reviews.title: Safe and easily accessible
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t buy this thing years ago. I was on the fence on whether to buy the biometric or the push button. I ended up going for the push button after I read somebody’s review that said they open it before bed and close it when they wake up. That’s exactly what I do now and it makes me feel safe knowing that it is locked when it needs to be and unlocked when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Dumbdumb

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, I love that it has a light inside. Make sure you get it anchored into a stud, even at that it would only take someone 30 seconds with a crowbar, the design isn't really intended to be "anti- theft" though so I wont fault it. Just be aware, if you are going out of town or something, either take it with you or put it in a wall safe or vault type gun safe. It totally does the job to keep it out of the hands of little ones while keeping it readily accessible
customer_reviews.author: Vancouver Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great safe to put away a CCW pistol when you get home so you don't have to unload
customer_reviews.text: A couple complaints: the mounting bracket has a top for mounting under a counter/table and looks ugly if you mount against a wall; the top needs to be cut off to make it look nice. It makes a pretty loud 'clunk' when opening. not great for 'bump in the night' investigations.
customer_reviews.author: andrewwynn

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad safe but too loud when it opens
customer_reviews.text: It fits my glock 21C perfectly. It opens every time. But it is loud when it opens. I personally don't like that about it. And the directions to secure it are not very clear. Took a bit of effort to attach it to the back of my night stand. It is functional and I'm confident it will work every time. But I'll probably move it to a different spot in the house at some point and upgrade my bedroom safe to something different.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Decent... with a few objections
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all. My main two complaints are: 1) There doesn't appear to be anything that keeps the safe locked to the mounting hardware. If you use the supplied mounting hardware, the safe can be easily removed and taken (while still locked). 2) The unlock sound is much louder than I'd like. Anyone in the room will know you just unlocked it, even in a semi-noisy room and even if the safe is under a desk or in a cabinet. It isn't very subtle at all. Otherwise, it is good and as advertised. I don't regret the purchase and may buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: AaronM

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It’s not fireproof, but definitely makes securing a small to medium size automatic in a hidden secondary location in your house easy. That way if you aren’t carrying or near your primary weapon, you can hopefully get to this secondary one. Remember two is one and one is none. Redundancy is the key to a successful emergency plan
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Prefer this pushbutton model to the biometric reader
customer_reviews.text: I preferred this pushbutton model for the biometric thumbprint reader. The boxes are constructed pretty much the same way. A couple of times the biometrics would not read our prints and had to be reprogrammed which of course could really be a problem under certain situations.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C.

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second safe. The first one is over a year old and is perfect. This one is loose in the drop unit,not the actual install. It's very tightly secured but the drop down unit wobbles. I emailed but I'm still waiting.
customer_reviews.author: TRACIE

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic safe
customer_reviews.text: Quality safe for the price point. Easy to install. Easy to set code. Functions perfectly. Like the mute button as the beep when pressing the numbers is pretty loud. Holds a glock 19 with tactical light no problem with no modifications. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to install. Yes it is
customer_reviews.text: I just installed mine. It is easy to install. The safe is really nice. I shopped all over town, for the price it is great. Other reviews says the beep is Loud when you use the buttons. There is a mute option. I am really happy I purchased this. I am thinking about getting a second one for downstairs. I highly recommend this product. Now we have one in the Chamber My girlfriend feels safe now. This safe was her idea. Five stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: What I like most about this is the compactness of the safe, the hiding it lends itself to. However, there is a major flaw. Often times, it does not register your first press of a button. This is rather random and occurs with new or non new batteries. This could obviously result in your demise; and as such, it gets a 1 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Apathetic

customer_reviews.title: Better hardware is needed for installation!
customer_reviews.text: It may have only 4 buttons but the combination are much higher since you can hold two buttons at the same time and that would only count as one. It can have as many as 6 commands to open the safe. It hold standard Glock Just fine as long as you do not have extended barrel. You have to get better hardware to install it. What it comes with is not good enough. I still Love mine regardless of the hardware issue.
customer_reviews.author: Fm

customer_reviews.title: It’s the perfect line between easily accessible and security from small kids.
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect line between easily accessible and security from small kids. The only dont side for me was the fast and violent way the drawer releases. You and anyone in the house knows when this thing opens even if you assist the door open. In the long run, it’s a must have product and I plan to get two more for various rooms in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mississippi Mud

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This safe functions like its designed to. The only complaint I have is that when installed the two knurled screws that hold the door on that are located on the bottom of the unit striped out so the door is only held on by one screw. Any thief that knows this can unscrew the two screws (one in my case) and pop/pry the door off and get your gun. I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: jrank001

customer_reviews.title: Love this safe...best out there
customer_reviews.text: Great safe for an EDC pistol. Have it installed right at the front door. Able to unholster and place inside without much of a "show" in front of the kids, company, etc. Got it during a amazing sale so the price you couldn't beat with a stick. Would definitely recommend this for any gun owner. I will be buying my 3rd one for the office soon. Tamper feature is a great option to have especially with children. My only con for it is that when it releases to open, it is loud as others have stated. But very easily to live with, with the audible openning.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: I’ll get a different one
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easy and feels pretty secure. Glad it has a key back up. Opens quickly enough. The unlocking mechanism is very noisy. No way to open this thing discreetly. Wish the number key pad had 0-9 (like Fords) so you could program any number combo instead of just 1-4. Update: battery life is terrible (3rd battery in 12 months) and dies without warning. I don’t operate the mechanism often, and it eventually just doesn’t work because the battery is dead. Not reliable for emergency access.
customer_reviews.author: Joel M

customer_reviews.title: This one with the four button is better than the biometric since it doesn't drain the battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I own both this safe and the biometric option. This one with the four button is better than the biometric since it doesn't drain the battery as quickly and works with gloves / wet hands. This is the best safe for a single gun and If i need another one this is the model I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: JSA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bedside safe, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I've had the safe for 6 months now and I've never had to replace the battery. Also, the keyhole seems much sturdier than is suggested in other reviews. All in all this is a great bedside safe and I would buy it again. It is also interesting to note that though it only has four buttons for the keypad (1-4), these buttons can be doubled up so that multiples can be pressed at one time. This can make your combination much harder to crack for a thief or a little one.
customer_reviews.author: B.J.

customer_reviews.title: super nice and works well
customer_reviews.text: super nice and works well. no issues and could not get it to replicate any issues other users have complained about such as getting into it with any code. the safe drops nicely and pretty quickly. have had over 6 months now and open it a few times a week and still have not had to replace them. installation is a bit complicated but can be done fairly quickly once you figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Hi Point
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to mount w/ instructions Slim design One of the only vertical safes Fast Cons If you enter code to fast doesn't trigger mechanism Does not fit full size HI point 40 or 45 I wanted it to mount in my car, which I did and it worked great, but my hi point pistol didn't fit. I didn't want to put a nicer pistol in my car.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Liked it at first
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for just over a year, and I initially liked it. Recently, I've noticed that it BURNS through batteries, and you have to remove the lower portion to replace the battery. I replaced in about 3-4 months ago, then went to open it yesterday and it flashed red repeatedly and wouldn't open without the key. I intended to use this as a concealed safe for my primary weapon (the weapon I'd use to defend myself if my home was invaded in the middle of the night). Not very useful if the tray won't open when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Film Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out safe!
customer_reviews.text: Best bedside Handgun Safe I have seen. You can program as little as 4 buttoms/pads to gain entry to the safe. You may have the opened cavity lighted or not. No lids to lift or pull down, or doors to swing from right or left. Just press the four entry pads, gun cavity drops down, back strap presents ready for thumb and finger pick-up. Bought one and then a second. This would also makes a low profile, rabid release safe for under the desk applications.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm. Perfect Design.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has been installed next to my bed on my nightstand for a couple of months now and I could not be more satisfied. It allows me to open it at night when I come home and give me access to my Ruger American with 18 rounds so that I have access to it anytime I need it. I leave the gun in it while it is open. This is a well thought out product so I am a bit miffed as to why it is no longer in production. If you can, I would say 'get one'.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe Safe
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS SAFE!! The code stopped working randomly and would not allow me to re-enter a new code. In addition, the battery door compartment broke when I tried to replace the battery. This safe is junk and is not reliable. Useless within a year while seldom used
customer_reviews.author: Sola Fide

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product in my opinion. It does a great job of quickly providing access to a firearm with minimal access requirements. It does come with what some reviewers have judged to be sub-standard hardware, but that is easily remedied with better lag screws. Will it stop a determined thief? No. Will it stop kids and casual searchers? Yes. The complaints about noise are not based on fact from my experience, this safe opens quickly and it's not very loud in my opinion. Having bought and installed it myself I would definitely buy it again, and recommend it to anyone with a pistol that they want to have fast, secure access to.
customer_reviews.author: Tagg B

customer_reviews.title: Im no jack bauer, but I am reaponsible for the safety of my fam.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this safe. Love the mounting option next to night stand. Have practiced a lot of punching in code from bed, acquiring pistol, and clearing house. I used a razorblade to add a spot for my spare mag. Hopefully i dont need 34 rounds but you never know.
customer_reviews.author: Bigtexasmike

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 small dislike. I wish the operation of the safe was ...
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 really. Only 1 small dislike. I wish the operation of the safe was quieter. Not the buttons, I know those can be silenced, but the actual opening. It's quite loud in the quiet of the night and i feel like it would possibly alert an intruder to your presence before you are ready. Other than that, it's ideal. Just like it says; fast, easy, and secure!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: When the power dies you are stuck
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until the power died. Then it required a key to unlock as the batteries had also expired. The batteries are a pain to replace. Good unit but I wish it would mechanically open in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Batteries die quickly
customer_reviews.text: Overall not too bad but the batteries die quickly. They are also a real pain to replace unless you are a contortionist. The LED light is right by the battery compartment and shines directly in your eyes so you can't see what you're doing when trying to replace the battery. I have stopped using the keypad and using only the key. It's more reliable that way.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few years ago, installed it onto my bed, used it very little, and now the door just fails to open without use of the hard key. Stay away from this product if you expect reliable access to your weapon when things go bill in the night.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect night-stand gun safe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bedside gun safe for a hundred bucks. It conveniently fits a full-size home protection handgun as well as a daily carry pocket handgun that needs to be kept out of little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Blair

customer_reviews.title: Good item for easy access .. need to have better buttons .
customer_reviews.text: I am testing it but sometime the button does not response which is not a good thing if you need to gain access quick and life depend on it. keep testing your item to get familiar with it and how to use it and familiar with your buttons.
customer_reviews.author: A.G T

customer_reviews.title: We have 2 Combination versions LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of the Combination version. We have grandkids in the house frequently but also want a firearm at the ready. We are very happy with both of the safes. We opted against the biometric version. The combo versions have been reliable and after having both safes for years now, we have only gone through 1 9-Volt battery. Make sure you know where your key is kept in case the battery dies on you unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.author: Edith B.

customer_reviews.title: small but decent
customer_reviews.text: Very small. plenty of room for my small handgun but nothing else. Only 4 numbers on the keypad is very limiting, I would like to use a combo I use regularly but not possible with only 1-4 to chose from. Ships with short mounting screws to mount to solid wood. Had to use different screws to go through drywall into a stud. I probably would have bought something larger that could hold some ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Megan H.

customer_reviews.title: Wife isn't to happy about mounting it on the side of the night ...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. Wife isn't to happy about mounting it on the side of the night stand. It's the price of safety for the gran children.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Gun Vault works as advertised. Fairly easy to mount, depending on which place you put it. Reason for 4 stars and not 5. 1) Wish if had the thumb print option to save time. With little ones running around a longer code is necessary to insure that they wont accidentally fall appon the right sequence. Thumb print would eliminate all possibilities and if I did need it in a quick response, a thumb is quicker than typing in any decent length code. All in all it does what it says it does. Sturdy for the most part. I would recommend it. Easy to install too.
customer_reviews.author: Meher Sharif

customer_reviews.title: Good while it works
customer_reviews.text: Have a full sized glock in there and it works well for a few years. Battery running out, requires you to use key. I lost my key and I can not access it now because battery is drained. Will have to crack it open some how.
customer_reviews.author: abrahamaku

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This safe is easy to use. When you enter in the code, the safe drops open. There is a nice light that automatically turns on when the safe opens. Note that it is kind of loud when it opens, so it certainly wouldn't be "stealthy" when you are opening.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Paul

customer_reviews.title: Keep your weapon safe and on hand.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome safe, compact and the programmable multi key code combinations makes it very secure. It's fitted with a foam insert to hold your weapon snug. Included corrosion resistance bar keeps your weapon free of unwanted build up due to storage. Mountable under a desk or in a closet. Keeps your weapon safe and secure until you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Tyson

customer_reviews.title: What could make it perfect? Have the keypad able to light up in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a near-perfect bed-side gun safe. What could make it perfect? Have the keypad able to light up in the dark! Otherwise, execution is darn-near flawless and works perfectly. I keep a full size Smith M&P in mine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hadden

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should, I have the combination safe.
customer_reviews.text: Combination safe works well. The only dislike is that the numbers are barely readable. I added some reflective numbers next to the buttons so they can be read more easily.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted it to be
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Stack-On biometric safe at my bedside for some time. Out of frustration of that safe opening maybe 50% of the time - I ordered this one. This safe is absolutely perfect. It does the job exactly as it should. I really like the feature to tell if the safe has been attempted to be opened. Programming is simple. Install was simple. I put it on the back side of my nightstand. Finally, a safe and accessible solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mulek

customer_reviews.title: too clunky and too loud when it releases - would ...
customer_reviews.text: too clunky and too loud when it releases - would not purchase again, but already installed and attempting to use anyway
customer_reviews.author: H Paul Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Should keep kids out...
customer_reviews.text: Kids, without the combo, would have a tough time getting into this without ruining it. A thief - well, they'd have a little trouble, but would make off with it in the end. I'd totally recommend...
customer_reviews.author: b'dub

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Overall I liked the product, once the safe was activated it opened quickly giving me access to my firearm. It is a good design, my comments are as follows: 1. The mounting Bracket hole are approximately 2 inches apart. The standard wall stud is 1.5 inches wide. I had to drill an extra holes to accommodate my mounting solution. 2. I did find on several occasions that I needed to really take my time a press down on the numbers in order for it to read my combination. Again, overall it is a great product to protect my family,
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Solid Construction but a bit loud
customer_reviews.text: The opening process is a little loud even in a large room. I'm not sure you could open this and not let everyone know that something was happening ... they may not know it's a gun safe opening but it will draw attention. I pray I never have to use it but it seems very well built and I like the flashing lights that let you know if someone tried to open it and failed. I would really like a low battery warning on the outside LED so I don't try to open it and find I must use the keys. Solid construction and nice opening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best for smaller handguns
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Ruger LCR which is my nightstand gun. out of curiosity, I tried to put my Kimber tactical custom II full size in it, it barely fit, but the bottom of the magazine well touched the electronics and set off lights and a beeping sound, so I think a full size 45 is a no-go. however, I am very satisfied with my little LCR tucked in that nice foam ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: dale admire

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation. Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. Easy setup. Works well so far. Internal light upon opening is a nice feature. Only Complaint is extracting the firearm can be a bit cumbersome because the slide can easily hit the top of the vault and hinder a smooth quick extraction no matter the type of pistol. Holds as small as a S&W M&P Shield or as large as a Beretta 92FS with no problem. Not built to keep out a thief but will do a good job at keeping the kids out.
customer_reviews.author: Krys

customer_reviews.title: Great quick access safe.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my living room closet. It works well and has a light inside it. Opens very quickly and my glock 19 fits perfect. A safe is a must have if you have kids around.
customer_reviews.author: S. Solly

customer_reviews.title: Needs A Few Tweeks
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid and conceptually brilliant...BUT... battery life could be improved, other-than-wood mounting adapters should be supplied, batter area could be easier to get to, door bounce-on-open loud enough to alert an intruder if sournding area is quit such at nighttime. Improvements can be made but all-in-all, this is a great lock-away. I don't call it a safe as with the time a burglar would have when a home owner not being home, this thing could be opened. Mine is to keep visitors, especially younger ones away from weaponry. This is where this product shines 😃
customer_reviews.author: Domino

customer_reviews.title: I don't see the point of a safe like this that when you need to open it
customer_reviews.text: I never get a low battery warning. Instead, periodically when I go to open the safe it flashes as me and won't open. I don't see the point of a safe like this that when you need to open it, the battery is dead and the safe won't open!
customer_reviews.author: James Foxall

customer_reviews.title: Great way to conceal firearms
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nifty little safe that allows you to conceal your firearms a little better than the obvious safe in the closet or night stand. I like that you can press more than one key at a time as part of your combination. If you enter too many wrong combinations at once, it locks you out for a couple of minutes. Installation was really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

product_meta.title: GunVault SV500 - SpeedVault Handgun Safe
product_meta.description:
The GunVault speedvault keeps your and gun safe, secure and ready for action. Offering a revolutionary design, the speedvault digital quick access gun safe is equally as fast as it is discreet. It is the ideal choice for a home or business looking for added security. Constructed of 18-gauge steel. Holds 12 million selected access codes. For maximum efficiency, GunVault recommends using an all alkaline battery with an expiration date of 5 years in the future for all products.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Keep your handgun safe, secure and ready for action with the SpeedVault. Offering a revolutionary design, the SpeedVault is equally as fast as it is discreet. It is the ideal choice for a home or business looking for added security.
feature_bullets: Exterior dimensions: 6.5 inch high x 3.5 inch wide x 13 inch depth
Interior dimensions: 2.75 inch high x 5.75 inch wide x 8.5 inch depth
Mountable, protective foam liner, audio/LED low Battery warning, interior courtesy light, tamper indicator, computer Black access after repeated invalid entries and backup override key included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,777 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
